required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioimpedance as a Diagnostic Tool for Assessing the Need for Socket Modification in Transtibial Amputees
clinical_study.official_title: Portable Bioimpedance Monitoring: Testing a New Diagnostic Interface

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the proposed study is to conduct research on individuals with lower limb amputation, evaluating if residual limb fluid volume data collected using a novel non-invasive device is beneficial towards prosthetic prescription, fit, and comfort as determined by amputee test subjects and practitioners (prosthetists). Participants' residual limb fluid volume will be monitored through bioimpedance analysis both before and after a practitioner-issued modification to the prosthesis as an observational cohort study and then as a blinded randomized control trial in which the data may or may not be shared with the practitioner before the modification is made to the prosthesis.

primary_outcome.measure: Socket comfort score, measured by how comfortable the patient's limb is within the socket
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to quantify the overall comfort of their prosthesis by giving it a score between 0 and 10 with 0 as the least comfortable possible and 10 being the most comfortable possible.

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthesis satisfaction, measured by the patient's overall satisfaction with their entire prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their overall satisfaction with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from extremely happy to extremely unhappy.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall walking, measured by patients' ability to walk while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their overall ability to walk with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking in close spaces, measured by the patient's ability to walk in tight spaces while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk in close spaces with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking up stairs, measured by the patients ability to climb stairs while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk up stairs with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking down stairs, measured by the patients ability to descend stairs while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk down stairs with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking up a hill, measured by the patient's ability to climb a hill while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk up a steep hill with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking down a hill, measured by the patient's ability to descend a hill while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk down a steep hill with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking on streets and sidewalks, measured by the patient's ability to walk on paved surfaces while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk on streets and sidewalks with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Walking on slippery surfaces, measured by the patients ability to walk on slick surfaces while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate their ability to walk on slippery surfaces with their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "No Problem Walking" to "Cannot Walk at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Limb sweating, measured by the patients' perception of how much their limb sweats while wearing their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how much their residual limb sweats, while wearing their prosthesis, by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "Not At All" to "Extreme Amount".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthesis smell, measured by the patients' perception of unpleasant odor in their prosthesis after it is worn
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how much their prosthesis smells by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "Not At All" to "Extreme Amount".

primary_outcome.measure: Residual limb swelling, measured by the patients' perception of how often residual limb swelling effects the fit of the patient's prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how much of the time their residual limb is swollen to a degree that prosthesis fit is effected by drawing a line on a continuous scale running from "Not At All" to "Extreme Amount".

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of rashes, measured by how much the patient was bothered by rashes on their residual limb
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how bothered they are by rashes, on their residual limb, by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "No Occurrence" to "Extremely Bothersome".

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of ingrown hairs, measured by how much the patient was bothered by ingrown hairs on their residual limb
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how bothered they are by ingrown hairs, on their residual limb, by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "No Occurrence" to "Extremely Bothersome".

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of blisters, measured by how much the patient was bothered by blisters on their residual limb
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how bothered they are by blisters, on their residual limb, by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "No Occurrence" to "Extremely Bothersome".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthesis fit, measured by how well the prosthesis as a whole fits the patient
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how well their prosthesis fits by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "Excellent" to "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthesis weight, measured by how encumbered the participant is by their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to rate the weight of their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "Excellent" to "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthesis comfort while standing, measured by how comfortable the patient's prosthesis is while standing
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate the comfort of their prosthesis, while standing, by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "Excellent" to "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthesis comfort while sitting, measured by how comfortable the patient's prosthesis is while seated
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate the comfort of their prosthesis, while sitting, by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "Excellent" to "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Balance, measured by the prosthesis's impact on the patient's balance
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how frequently they feel off balance while using their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale that ranges from "Never" to "All the Time".

primary_outcome.measure: Effort, measured by how much energy the patient expends while using their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how much energy they extend to use their prosthesis by drawing a line on a continuous scale ranging from "None at All" to "Completely Exhausting".

primary_outcome.measure: Feel, measured by how the prosthesis's texture and heat dissipation effects the comfort of their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate how their prosthesis feels on their residual limb, in terms of temperature and texture, by drawing a line on a continuous scale ranging from "Best Possible" to "Worst Possible".

primary_outcome.measure: Donning, measured by how difficult it is for the patient to get into their prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to indicate the ease with which they don their prosthesis on a continuous scale ranging from "Excellent" to "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthetist communication assessment, measured by the communication efficacy between the prosthetist and their patient
primary_outcome.description: Participants' prosthetists are asked to rate their ability to communicate the need for sock or behavioral changes to their patients participating in the study. They will indicate the score using a scale from 0 to 10 with 10 being the best possible communication and 0 being the worst possible communication.

primary_outcome.measure: Socket modification, measured by physical changes made to the patient's prosthesis
primary_outcome.description: Participants' prosthetists are asked the type of socket modification(s) that they implemented in free response format.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of socket modification, measured by the impact of the physical modification made to the prosthesis to socket fit
primary_outcome.description: Participants' prosthetists are asked to rate the effectiveness of the modification(s) that they implemented on a scale of 0 to 10 in which 10 is "Excellent" and 0 is "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Volume management strategy, measured by behavioral changes made by the patient to minimize volume changes in their residual limb
primary_outcome.description: Participants' prosthetists are asked the changes to the participant's volume management strategy that they recommended in free response format.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of volume management strategy, measured by the impact of the changes in volume management to socket fit
primary_outcome.description: Participants' prosthetists are asked to rate the effectiveness of the strategies that they recommended on a scale of 0 to 10 in which 10 is "Excellent" and 0 is "Terrible".

primary_outcome.measure: Modification/strategy satisfaction, measured by overall satisfaction of all methods employed
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to rate their overall satisfaction with the socket modification and/or volume management change that was used for each participant by indicating a score from 0 to 10 with 10 being "Extremely Satisfied" and 0 being "Not Satisfied".

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthetist impression of bioimpedance results, measured by general feedback from clinicians on the bioimpedance data they are given
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to describe their impression of the bioimpedance results in a free response format.

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthetist use of bioimpedance results, measured by general feedback on how the clinicians use the bioimpedance data they are given
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to describe, in free response format how they used the bioimepance results to inform their clinical practice

primary_outcome.measure: Bioimpedance usefulness for socket design, measured by general feedback on how useful bioimpedance is for informing decisions on socket modifications
primary_outcome.description: Participants' prosthetists are asked to rate the effectiveness of the strategies that they recommended on a scale of 0 to 10 in which 10 is "Very Useful" and 0 is "Not Useful".

primary_outcome.measure: Bioimpedance for volume management, measured by general feedback on how useful bioimpedance is for informing decisions on socket modifications
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to rate the utility of bioimpedance results in recommending volume management strategies to their patients. The rating scale is 0 to 10 with 10 being "Very Useful" and 0 being "Not Useful".

primary_outcome.measure: Continuing use of bioimpedance results, measured by how likely clinicians will be to use bioimpedance data in the future
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to indicate how likely they are to request bioimpedance data for their other patients by selecting a score from 0 to 10 with 10 with being "Very Likely" and 0 being "Not Likely at All".

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of bioimpedance, measured by how bioimpedance data changed the way prosthetists approach problem issues of socket fit
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to quantify the impact that the bioimpedance had on the manner in which they approached the issue by rating the impact from 0 to 10 with 10 being "Very Impactful" and 0 being "No Impact".

primary_outcome.measure: Most useful bioimpedance data, measured by which element of the bioimpedance data is most useful to clinicians
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to select from a list which bioimpedance data was most useful to them. The list items are: magnitude of fluid volume change over the whole day, fluid volume change by regions of the limb, fluid volume change from different activities, rate of fluid volume change over the whole day, and rate of fluid volume change over specific activity intervals

primary_outcome.measure: Bioimpedance and communication measured by general feedback on whether prosthetist-patient communication is improved through use of bioimpedance data
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to indicate the degree to which their use bioimpedance results improved the communication between them and their patients. They indicate this by selecting a value from 0 to 10 with 10 being "Highly Impactful" and 0 being "No Impact".

primary_outcome.measure: Outcome enhancement, measured by the degree to which outcomes are improved using bioimpedance data
primary_outcome.description: Prosthetists are asked to indicated the degree to which clinical outcomes were enhanced by the use of bioimpedance results. They indicate this by selecting a value from 0 to 10 with 10 being "Positive Impact" and 0 being "Negative Impact".

arm_group.description: In Arm 1, bioimpedance measurements are taken by research staff. The participants also wear an ActiGraph monitor for at least one week prior to their prosthetist preforming modifications to their socket.

Conclusions drawn from data gathered in Arm 1 will be given to the participant's prosthetist, along with their bioimpedance data from Arm 2, to inform the practitioner's decision on when a modification to the socket is warranted. The results will be compared to those of Arm 3.
Bioimpedance data will be collected from participants in Arm 3 in parallel with those in Arm 2. However, no data will be provided to the participant's prosthetist.

intervention.description: Data obtained from the arm 1 cohort will be used to inform socket modifications made for arm 2 cohort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Transtibial amputees, unilateral or bilateral
- Amputation at least 18 months prior
- Walking activity of at least 7 hours per week
- Medicare functional classification level of 2 or higher
- Residual limb length of at least 9 centimeters
- Detrimental impacts to socket fit caused by residual limb volume fluctuations
- Indication for augmented suspension, socket modification/change, sock application removal or activity modification
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incidence of skin breakdown
- Inability to ambulate continuously on a level walkway
